features.title: Feature One
features.description: Brief, supportive explanation of what this feature offers.

name: GBV Aware Hub
shortDescription: A central hub for trauma-informed GBV awareness, resources, and support.
longDescription: The GBV Aware Hub brings together learning, stories, and support in one trauma-informed digital space. It is designed to help communities understand GBV, find trustworthy resources, and connect with support services in a safe and respectful way.

name: Real-Time GBV Insights Dashboard
shortDescription: A live, anonymised dashboard that visualises GBV-related trends and support activity.
longDescription: The Real-Time GBV Insights Dashboard offers anonymised, high-level data to help organisations and communities understand trends in support-seeking, outreach engagement, and service usage. The dashboard avoids graphic content and focuses on context, care, and responsible interpretation.

name: Support Services Directory
shortDescription: A curated directory of hotlines, shelters, NGOs, and community resources.
longDescription: The Support Services Directory offers a carefully curated list of hotlines, shelters, legal clinics, psychosocial services, and community organisations. The focus is on accessibility, clarity, and trauma-sensitive descriptions that help users choose what feels safest for them.

name: Guided Learning Journeys
shortDescription: Structured learning paths on GBV awareness, allyship, and safer responses.
longDescription: Guided Learning Journeys are structured, step-by-step modules that help people deepen their understanding of GBV, learn how to respond in supportive ways, and practise allyship. Content is paced gently, using real-world scenarios and reflection prompts.

name: Anonymous Check-In Tool
shortDescription: A gentle, anonymous tool to help people reflect on how they are feeling and access tailored information.
longDescription: The Anonymous Check-In Tool offers a quiet space where people can answer a few reflective questions, receive supportive messages, and see suggestions for resources that may be helpful. No identifying details are required, and users decide whether to reach out further.
